model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Co-workers A, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Co-workers A: Hey, guess what? I sang a solo at church this past weekend!
Co-workers B: That's awesome! I didn't know you sang.
Co-workers A: Yeah, it's something I've always loved to do but haven't had the chance to do it in a while.
Co-workers B: Well, it sounds like you did a great job. What did you sing?
Co-workers A: I sang "Amazing Grace". It's always been one of my favorites.
Co-workers B: That's such a beautiful song. You have a great voice.
Co-workers A: Thank you! It was really nerve-wracking, but I'm glad I did it.
Co-workers B: I'm sure the audience loved it. You've really got some talent.

[MEMORY]
Co-worker A and Co-worker B both plan to treat themselves to a nice dinner with their paychecks. Co-worker A suggests celebrating their detective work with drinks after work. Co-worker A is observant and did some research on social media to find out that Co-worker B is married. Co-worker B was surprised when Co-worker A found out they were married.

Co-worker A and Co-worker B both plan to treat themselves to a nice dinner with their paychecks. Co-worker A suggests celebrating their detective work with drinks after work. Co-worker A enjoys solving puzzles and mysteries, even considering becoming a detective. Co-worker A has a talent for solving puzzles and mysteries.
